page.title: 10Peoples Attitudes
page.content: A short questionnaire was sent to most households, about 75% returned it. Of these, 100% were happy living here, and 100% were optimistic for the future for themselves. A few worried about the future for their children and grandchildren. Worries recorded were about the increasing amount of violence, danger of nuclear war, general lowering of standards, lack of employment for the young. When asked "Is there anything in the area that disturbs you, and if so what would you like done about it?"; most said "No". A few complained about excessive numbers of military low flying aircraft. 1 worried about locals leaving to be replaced by weekenders. 1 complained about lack of cheap rural bus service. Every household has at least 1 car.
